sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The despairing lover, whose minde was much tormented, because of his true-love hee thought hee was prevented To the tune of, Aime not too high.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
printed for F. Coules, dwelling in the Old-Bayly, London : [1633?]
Verse - "Breake heart and dye, I may no longer liue,". Publication date suggested by STC. In two parts; part 2 has caption title: A constant and a kinde maid. Printed on the verso of STC 11154. Imperfect as filmed on Early English books, 1475-1640, reel 851: part 2 only. Reproductions of the original in the British Library.
=======
